intro: Rubus × nigellus, commonly known as the blackberry bramble, is a hybrid species within the Rubus genus. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces aggregate fruits composed of small, drupe-like berries. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in woodland edges and disturbed soils. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and horticulture.
